oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson and Waxhaw Massacre
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This image shows a boy looking on as women and children weep over a dead man in the foreground as a home burns in the background. Depicts the Battle of the Waxhaws during the American Revolution.

Andrew Jackson was born on March 15, 1767 in the Waxhaw settlements on the North Carolina and South Carolina border. He was born to Scots-Irish immigrants and was brought up in the midst of the American Revolutionary War. As a young man, Jackson participated in the Revolutionary War. During the conflict, his mother and two brothers died.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, --1767 - 1845
Photographs
